1.text: Wine is a scorner, strong drink is raging; and whoso erreth thereby is not wise.

2.text: The terror of a king is as the roaring of a lion: he that provoketh him to anger sinneth against his own soul.

3.text: It is an honour for a man to cease from strife; but every fool rusheth into it.

4.text: The sluggard will not plough by reason of the winter; he shall beg in harvest, and have nothing.

5.text: Counsel in the heart of man is deep water, and a man of understanding draweth it out.

6.text: Most men will proclaim every one his own kindness; but a faithful man who shall find?

7.text: The righteous walketh in his integrity: blessed are his children after him!

8.text: A king sitting on the throne of judgment scattereth away all evil with his eyes.

9.text: Who can say, I have made my heart clean, I am pure from my sin?

10.text: Divers weights, divers measures, even both of them are abomination to Jehovah.

11.text: Even a child is known by his doings, whether his work be pure, and whether it be right.

12.text: The hearing ear, and the seeing eye, Jehovah hath made even both of them.

13.text: Love not sleep, lest thou come to poverty; open thine eyes, [and] thou shalt be satisfied with bread.

14.text: Bad! bad! saith the buyer; but when he is gone his way, then he boasteth.

15.text: There is gold, and a multitude of rubies; but the lips of knowledge are a precious Jewel.

16.text: Take his garment that is become surety [for] another, and hold him in pledge for strangers.

17.text: Bread of falsehood is sweet to a man, but afterwards his mouth shall be filled with gravel.

18.text: Plans are established by counsel; and with good advice make war.

19.text: He that goeth about talebearing revealeth secrets; therefore meddle not with him that openeth his lips.

20.text: Whoso curseth his father or his mother, his lamp shall be put out in the blackest darkness.

21.text: An inheritance obtained hastily at the beginning will not be blessed in the end.

22.text: Say not, I will recompense evil: wait on Jehovah, and he shall save thee.

23.text: Divers weights are an abomination unto Jehovah; and a false balance is not good.

24.text: The steps of a man are from Jehovah; and how can a man understand his own way?

25.text: It is a snare to a man rashly to say, It is hallowed, and after vows to make inquiry.

26.text: A wise king scattereth the wicked, and bringeth the wheel over them.

27.text: Manâ€™s spirit is the lamp of Jehovah, searching all the inner parts of the belly.

28.text: Mercy and truth preserve the king; and he upholdeth his throne by mercy.

29.text: The glory of young men is their strength; and the beauty of old men is the grey head.

30.text: Wounding stripes purge away evil, and strokes [purge] the inner parts of the belly.
